<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>
<!DOCTYPE DOCSENT SYSTEM './docsent.dtd'>
<DOCSENT DID='21'>
  <BODY>
    <HEADLINE>
      <S SNO='1' PAR='1' RSNT='1'>USATODAY.com - Small plane slams into Milan skyscraper</S>
    </HEADLINE>
    <TEXT>
      <S SNO='2' PAR='2' RSNT='1'>Smoke billows from the Pirelli building.</S>
      <S SNO='3' PAR='3' RSNT='1'>MILAN, Italy (AP)   A small plane with only the pilot on board on Thursday crashed into a landmark skyscraper in downtown Milan.</S>
      <S SNO='4' PAR='4' RSNT='1'>Smoke poured out of the 30-story building and there was no immediate word of any victims.</S>
      <S SNO='5' PAR='5' RSNT='1'>The building houses the regional government offices, authorities said.</S>
      <S SNO='6' PAR='6' RSNT='1'>Police officer Celerissimo De Simone said the pilot of the Piper aircraft sent out a distress call at 5:50 p.m. just before the crash near Milan's main train station.</S>
      <S SNO='7' PAR='7' RSNT='1'>RAI state TV reported that the pilot said the SOS was because of engine trouble.</S>
      <S SNO='8' PAR='8' RSNT='1'>The weather was clear at the time.</S>
      <S SNO='9' PAR='9' RSNT='1'>Police cordoned off the area as people gawked at the skyscraper.</S>
      <S SNO='10' PAR='10' RSNT='1'>At least one ambulance was dispatched.</S>
      <S SNO='11' PAR='11' RSNT='1'>Initially, Marcello Pera, president of Italy's senate, said it "very probably" appeared to be a terrorist attack.</S>
      <S SNO='12' PAR='12' RSNT='1'>Later, his spokesman said Pera had spoken with the Interior Minister and the crash didn't appear to be any kind of an attack.</S>
      <S SNO='13' PAR='13' RSNT='1'>The crash put a hole in the 25th floor of the Pirelli building, and smoke was seen pouring from the opening.</S>
      <S SNO='14' PAR='14' RSNT='1'>Police and ambulances rushed to the building.</S>
      <S SNO='15' PAR='15' RSNT='1'>The Pirelli skyscraper, located near the central train station, is Italy's first skyscraper and one of the world's tallest concrete buildings.</S>
      <S SNO='16' PAR='16' RSNT='1'>It was built in 1958 and designed by architects Gio Ponti and Pier Luigi Nervi.</S>
      <S SNO='17' PAR='17' RSNT='1'>The building is one of the main symbols of Milan, along with the city's cathedral.</S>
      <S SNO='18' PAR='18' RSNT='1'>"The president just moments ago was informed about the incident in Milan.</S>
      <S SNO='19' PAR='19' RSNT='1'>I have no additional information at all for you at this time.</S>
      <S SNO='20' PAR='20' RSNT='1'>This is a breaking story and we don't have anything else beyond that."</S>
      <S SNO='21' PAR='21' RSNT='1'>It was the second time since the Sept. 11 terror attacks on New York and Washington that a plane has struck a high-rise building.</S>
      <S SNO='22' PAR='22' RSNT='1'>On Jan. 5, a 15-year-old boy crashed a stolen plane into a building in Tampa, Fla.</S>
      <S SNO='23' PAR='23' RSNT='1'>He was the only casualty.</S>
      <S SNO='24' PAR='24' RSNT='1'>Copyright 2002 The Associated Press.</S>
      <S SNO='25' PAR='25' RSNT='1'>All rights reserved.</S>
      <S SNO='26' PAR='26' RSNT='1'>This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.</S>
      <S SNO='27' PAR='27' RSNT='1'>Gannett Co.</S>
      <S SNO='28' PAR='28' RSNT='1'>Inc.</S>
    </TEXT>
  </BODY>
</DOCSENT>
